intro: Taraxacum grossheimii, commonly known as the Grossheim's dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and a long, hollow stem that supports a single, yellow flower head. The plant produces a distinctive seed head composed of numerous parachute-like seeds, which are dispersed by the wind. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky soils. Taraxacum grossheimii is a perennial herb that is often found in arid and semi-arid environments.
